verses.verse: {The Conquest of Egypt and Cush} d In the year that the supreme commander, sent by Sargon the king of Assyria, came to Ashdod, attacked it, and captured it

at that time the Lord spoke through Amoz's son Isaiah: "Go loosen the sackcloth that's around your waist, {Lit. your hips and lower back} and take your sandals {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads sandal} off your feet." So that's what he did: he went around naked and barefoot.

Then the Lord said, "Just as my servant Isaiah has walked around naked and barefoot for three years as a sign and a warning for Egypt and Ethiopia, {I. e. Nubia, south of Egypt (modern northern Sudan)}

so the king of Assyria will lead away the Egyptian captives and exiles from Cush, {I. e. Nubia, south of Egypt (modern northern Sudan)} both the young and the old, naked and barefoot with even their buttocks uncovered to the shame {Or nakedness} of Egypt.
Then they will be dismayed and put to shame because of Cush, {I. e. Nubia, south of Egypt (modern northern Sudan)} their hope, and Egypt, their jewel. {Or pride}

At that time, the inhabitants of this coastland will say, «See, this is what has happened to those on whom we counted and relied {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read and to whom we fled} for help and deliverance from the king of Assyria! How, then, can we escape?»"
